intro: Pilosella parvistolona, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are surrounded by a ring of bracts, giving it a pearly appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Pilosella parvistolona is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
